card.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the customer responsible for?
choices: Ensuring that disk drives are wiped after use.
Ensuring that firmware is updated on hardware devices.
Ensuring that data is encrypted at rest.
Ensuring that network cables are category six or higher.
card.answer: Ensuring that data is encrypted at rest.

card.answer: Amazon EC2 with Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS)

Which of the following are advantages of AWS consolidated billing?
choices: The ability to receive one bill for multiple accounts
Service limits increasing by default in all accounts
A fixed discount on the monthly bill
The automatic extension of the master account's AWS support plan to all accounts
card.answer: The ability to receive one bill for multiple accounts

card.question: Which of the following are advantages of AWS consolidated billing?
choices: Potential volume discounts, as usage in all accounts is combined
Service limits increasing by default in all accounts
A fixed discount on the monthly bill
The automatic extension of the master account's AWS support plan to all accounts
card.answer: Potential volume discounts, as usage in all accounts is combined

card.question: Which of the following Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models provides the highest average savings compared to On-Demand pricing?
choices: One-year, No Upfront, Standard RI pricing
One-year, All Upfront, Convertible RI pricing
Three-year, All Upfront, Standard RI pricing
Three-year, No Upfront, Convertible RI pricing
card.answer: Three-year, All Upfront, Standard RI pricing

card.question: Compared with costs in traditional and virtualized data centers, AWS has:
choices: greater variable costs and greater upfront costs.
fixed usage costs and lower upfront costs.
lower variable costs and greater upfront costs.
lower variable costs and lower upfront costs.
card.answer: lower variable costs and lower upfront costs.

card.question: A characteristic of edge locations is that they:
choices: host Amazon EC2 instances closer to users.
help lower latency and improve performance for users.
cache frequently changing data without reaching the origin server.
card.answer: help lower latency and improve performance for users.

card.answer: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies

card.question: Which is a recommended pattern for designing a highly available architecture on AWS?
choices: Ensure that components have low-latency network connectivity.
Run enough Amazon EC2 instances to operate at peak load.
Ensure that the application is designed to accommodate failure of any single component.
Use a monolithic application that handles all operations.
card.answer: Ensure that the application is designed to accommodate failure of any single component.

card.question: One of the advantages to moving infrastructure from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud is:
choices: it allows the business to eliminate IT bills.
it allows the business to put a server in each customer's data center.
it allows the business to focus on business activities.
it allows the business to leave servers unpatched.
card.answer: it allows the business to focus on business activities.

card.answer: It distributes incoming application traffic across one or more Amazon EC2 instances.

A metrics repository with customizable notification thresholds and channels.
A security configuration repository with threat analytics.
A rule repository of a web application firewall with automated vulnerability prevention features.

card.answer: Request and wait for approval from the customer's internal security team, and then conduct testing.

Apply the same IAM policy to all IAM users with access to the same workload.
Apply an IAM policy to an Amazon Cognito user pool.
card.answer: Apply an IAM policy to an IAM group.

Contact AWS Support for a monthly bill.

card.question: How do customers benefit from Amazon's massive economies of scale?

New Amazon EC2 instance types providing the latest hardware
The ability to scale up and down when needed

card.answer: Periodic price reductions as the result of Amazon's operational efficiencies

choices: A company wants to move its main website to AWS from an on-premises web server.
A company has a number of application services whose Service Level Agreement (SLA) requires 99.999% uptime.
A company's heavily used legacy database is currently running on-premises.

card.answer: A company has a number of infrequent, interruptible jobs that are currently using On-Demand Instances.

choices: Moving from variable operational expense (opex) to upfront capital expense (capex).
Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable capital expense (capex).
Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable operational expense (opex).
Elimination of upfront capital expense (capex) and elimination of variable operational expense (opex)
card.answer: Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable operational expense (opex).

paying a daily rate regardless of time used.

choices: It verifies that hosted workloads are automatically compliant with the controls of supported compliance frameworks.
AWS is responsible for the maintenance of common compliance framework documentation.
It ensures the use of compliance frameworks that are being used by other cloud providers.
It will adopt new compliance frameworks as they become relevant to customer workloads.
card.answer: AWS is responsible for the maintenance of common compliance framework documentation.

card.question: Which of the following benefits does the AWS Compliance program provide to AWS customers?
choices: It verifies that hosted workloads are automatically compliant with the controls of supported compliance frameworks.
It assures customers that AWS is maintaining physical security and data protection.
It ensures the use of compliance frameworks that are being used by other cloud providers.
It will adopt new compliance frameworks as they become relevant to customer workloads.
card.answer: It assures customers that AWS is maintaining physical security and data protection.

choices: Maintaining the underlying Amazon EC2 hardware.
Managing the VPC network access control lists.
Deploying hardware in different Availability Zones.
card.answer: Managing the VPC network access control lists.

card.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the customer?
choices: Maintaining the underlying Amazon EC2 hardware.
Encrypting data in transit and at rest.
Deploying hardware in different Availability Zones.
card.answer: Encrypting data in transit and at rest.

card.question: Which scenarios represent the concept of elasticity on AWS?
choices: Scaling the number of Amazon EC2 instances based on traffic.
Resizing Amazon RDS instances as business needs change.
Using AWS compliance documents to accelerate the compliance process.
Having the ability to create and govern environments using code.
card.answer: Scaling the number of Amazon EC2 instances based on traffic.

card.question: Which scenarios represent the concept of elasticity on AWS?
choices: Automatically directing traffic to less-utilized Amazon EC2 instances.
Resizing Amazon RDS instances as business needs change.
Using AWS compliance documents to accelerate the compliance process.
Having the ability to create and govern environments using code.
card.answer: Automatically directing traffic to less-utilized Amazon EC2 instances.

card.question: When is it beneficial for a company to use a Spot Instance?
choices: When there is flexibility in when an application needs to run.
When an instance should not be stopped.
card.answer: When there is flexibility in when an application needs to run.

card.question: A company is considering moving its on-premises data center to AWS. What factors should be included in doing a Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) analysis?

card.question: When is it beneficial for a company to use a Spot Instance?
choices: When there is flexibility in when an application needs to run.
Labor costs to replace old servers
card.answer: Labor costs to replace old servers

card.question: How does AWS charge for AWS Lambda?
choices: Users bid on the maximum price they are willing to pay per hour.
Users choose a 1-, 3- or 5-year upfront payment term.
Users pay for the required permanent storage on a file system or in a database.
Users pay based on the number of requests and consumed compute resources.
card.answer: Users pay based on the number of requests and consumed compute resources.

card.question: What function do security groups serve related Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance security?

Secure AWS user accounts with AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.
Provide DDoS protection with AWS Shield.
Use Amazon CloudFront to protect the Amazon EC2 instance.
card.answer: Act as a virtual firewall for the Amazon EC2 instance.

card.answer: Create separate accounts for each department.

card.question: Which methods can be used to identify AWS costs by departments?
choices: Enable multi-factor authentication for the AWS account root user.
Use tags to associate each instance with a particular department.
card.answer: Use tags to associate each instance with a particular department.

card.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, customer responsibilities include which one of the following?
choices: Securing the hardware, software, facilities, and networks that run all products and services.
Providing certificates, reports, and other documentation directly to AWS customers under NDA.
Configuring the operating system, network, and firewall.
card.answer: Configuring the operating system, network, and firewall.

choices: Updating the network ACLs to block traffic to vulnerable ports.
Patching operating systems running on Amazon EC2 instances.
Updating the firmware on the underlying EC2 hosts.
Updating the security group rules to block traffic to the vulnerable ports.
card.answer: Updating the firmware on the underlying EC2 hosts.

card.question: Which architectural principle is used when deploying an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance in Multiple Availability Zone mode?
choices: Automate everything that can be automated.

card.question: What does it mean to grant least privilege to AWS IAM users?
choices: It is granting permissions to a single user only.
It is granting permissions using AWS IAM policies only.
It is granting AdministratorAccess policy permissions to trustworthy users.
It is granting only the permissions required to perform a given task.
card.answer: It is granting only the permissions required to perform a given task.

card.question: What is a benefit of loose coupling as a principle of cloud architecture design?
choices: It allows applications to have dependent workflows.
It prevents cascading failures between different components.
It allows companies to focus on their physical data center operations.
card.answer: It prevents cascading failures between different components.

card.question: A director has been tasked with investigating hybrid cloud architecture. The company currently accesses AWS over the public internet. Which service will facilitate private hybrid connectivity? Applying which AWS Cloud design principle will address the current design issue?

card.question: A company's web application currently has tight dependencies on underlying components, so when one component fails the entire web application fails.
choices: Implementing elasticity, enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.
Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.
card.answer: Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.

card.question: Why should a company choose AWS instead of a traditional data center?
choices: AWS provides users with full control over the underlying resources.
AWS does not require long-term contracts and provides a pay-as-you-go model.
AWS offers edge locations in every country, supporting global reach.
AWS has no limits on the number of resources that can be created.
card.answer: AWS does not require long-term contracts and provides a pay-as-you-go model.

card.question: How can a user protect against AWS service disruptions if a natural disaster affects an entire geographic area?
choices: Deploy applications across multiple Availability Zones within an AWS Region.
Use a hybrid cloud computing deployment model within the geographic area.
Deploy applications across multiple AWS Regions.
Store application artifacts using AWS Artifact and replicate them across multiple AWS Regions.
card.answer: Deploy applications across multiple AWS Regions.

card.question: How does AWS MOST effectively reduce computing costs for a growing start-up company?
choices: It provides on-demand resources for peak usage.
It automates the provisioning of individual developer environments.
It implements a fixed monthly computing budget.
card.answer: It provides on-demand resources for peak usage.

card.question: What is an example of high availability in the AWS Cloud?
choices: Consulting AWS technical support at any time day or night
Ensuring an application remains accessible, even if a resource fails
Making any AWS service available for use by paying on demand
Deploying in any part of the world using AWS Regions

What is an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role?
choices: A user associated with an AWS resource
A group associated with an AWS resource
An entity that defines a set of permissions for use with an AWS resource
An authentication credential associated with a multi-factor authentication (MFA) token
card.answer: An entity that defines a set of permissions for use with an AWS resource

card.question: What are the advantages of Reserved Instances?
choices: They provide a discount over on-demand pricing.
They provide access to additional instance types.
Customers can upgrade instances as new types become available.
card.answer: They provide a discount over on-demand pricing.

card.question: What are the advantages of Reserved Instances?
choices: Customers can reserve capacity in an Availability Zone.
They provide access to additional instance types.
Customers can upgrade instances as new types become available.
card.answer: Customers can reserve capacity in an Availability Zone.

card.question: How do Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups help achieve high availability for a web application?
choices: They automatically add more instances across multiple AWS Regions based on global demand of the application.
They automatically add or replace instances across multiple Availability Zones when the application needs it.
They enable the application's static content to reside closer to end users.
They are able to distribute incoming requests across a tier of web server instances.
card.answer: They automatically add or replace instances across multiple Availability Zones when the application needs it.

card.question: How can one AWS account use Reserved Instances from another AWS account?

By using AWS Organizations consolidated billing
By using the AWS Cost Explorer tool
card.answer: By using AWS Organizations consolidated billing
